body: What is the curl -V output of the working version?

curl 8.0.1 (Windows) libcurl/8.0.1 Schannel WinIDN
Release-Date: 2023-03-20
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps http https imap imaps pop3 pop3s smtp smtps telnet tftp
Features: AsynchDNS HSTS HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile NTLM SPNEGO SSL SSPI threadsafe Unicode UnixSockets

This version is installed by default on windows 10 64bit. it's works.

There are some significant differences in the way the two versions were compiled. I suspect the problem has to do with that and not with the curl version number, for example ENABLE_UNICODE may have been selected in one of them.
The working version has `Unicode` listed as a feature, the other one doesn't. Unicode on Windows is a long and sad saga that never ends.

I Understand. Thank you.
I downloaded the version with the problem from the curl project.
there is a difference at compile time, will this problem be fixed?

Yep, both Unicode and non-Unicode builds work either correctly or wrong depending on what one is expecting.

I have no plans to switch to Unicode in official builds at this time. One good reason is that it makes the libcurl API behaviour undefined with regards to the expected encoding/codepage of strings accepted and returned.

It also seems Microsoft noticed this issue after all, and [added support](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/apps/design/globalizing/use-utf8-code-page) for UTF-8 in the non-Unicode "ANSI" Win32 API: https://github.com/curl/curl/discussions/10446#discussioncomment-5273596. This solves the issue while using non-Unicode curl builds, but needs a Windows version that supports it.

I wonder if this patch would fix a non-Unicode `curl.exe` on supported systems (Windows Version 1903 (May 2019 Update)):
```diff
diff --git a/src/curl.rc b/src/curl.rc
index 11d528429..c81542430 100644
--- a/src/curl.rc
+++ b/src/curl.rc
@@ -107,6 +107,11 @@ BEGIN
         "</requestedPrivileges>"
       "</security>"
     "</trustInfo>"
+    "<application>"
+      "<windowsSettings>"
+        "<activeCodePage xmlns=""http://schemas.microsoft.com/SMI/2019/WindowsSettings"">UTF-8</activeCodePage>"
+      "</windowsSettings>"
+    "</application>"
   "</assembly>"
 END
```

I'd guess these "WIDE" calls used in non-Unicode builds may cause problems:
```
lib/strerror.c:  if(FormatMessageW((FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM |
src/tool_cb_wrt.c:    if(!WriteConsoleW(
```
I understand that there are complicated circumstances with Unicode. Thank you.

issue.title: curl.rc: enable UTF-8 support for the (non-Unicode) ANSI API

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Enable the switch in the curl.exe manifest to use this feature.

This allows Windows in supported versions (Windows Version 1903
from 2019 May) to use UTF-8 encoded Unicode strings in its 8-bit
ANSI API flavour.

This patch also switches back to using `fwrite()` instead of 
`WriteConsoleW()` when writing to a console that has `CP_UTF8`
set as its "ANSI" codepage. This allows to drop an internal CP 
translation from UTF-8 to UTF-16 ("WIDE") when the "ANSI" API
already speaks UTF-8.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/design/globalizing/use-utf8-code-page

Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/11461#issuecomment-1642393916
Fixes #11461
Closes #11482

---

Notice that this patch relies on the referenced Microsoft document and speculation. I have no Windows machine to test this on. Feedback is welcome if this resolves Unicode issues when using a non-Unicode `curl.exe`, and also whether there is any regression with older Windows versions, Unicode `curl.exe` builds or other build / environment combinations.

body:
> I have confirmed that this bug occurs in version 8.1.2_5, but not in version 8.0.1

I wonder what the reason might be. AFAIK there was no related (intented) change in curl between these versions, nor any curl-for-win (official Windows build) updates that might introduce such difference. curl-for-win had Unicode enabled only between mid-2020 to mid-2021 releases.

> One good reason is that it makes the libcurl API behaviour undefined with regards to the expected encoding/codepage of strings accepted and returned.

What do you mean by this? I thought all libcurl APIs used UTF8 for strings?

@MichalPetryka It's not defined in the libcurl documentation. libcurl handles strings transparently (as raw strings), without doing any translations internally. Except in some case (such as terminal output) in Windows non-Unicode builds, and except certain more cases in Windows Unicode builds.

> AFAIK there was no related (intented) change in curl between these versions, nor any curl-for-win (official Windows build) updates that might introduce such difference. curl-for-win had Unicode enabled only between mid-2020 to mid-2021 releases.

The reporter is using a Unicode build of curl 8.0.1 that comes with Windows and the non-Unicode build of curl 8.1.2 from curl-for-win. So it's probably the lack of Unicode.

I think there's nothing to be done for this issue. However I also think we could add the UTF-8 manifest you proposed to Unicode builds which should improve Unicode support in those builds.

> The reporter is using a Unicode build of curl 8.0.1 that comes with Windows and the non-Unicode build of curl 8.1.2 from curl-for-win. So it's probably the lack of Unicode.

This explains the difference indeed.

> I think there's nothing to be done for this issue. However I also think we could add the UTF-8 manifest you proposed to Unicode builds which should improve Unicode support in those builds.

Reopened #11482.

It's pending on how to update console output to omit translations in the "all-UTF-8" case. (This may not be critical anymore after your fix af3f4e419b9f339790de281c871640a773c391c0)
